title: Naskapi (2007) New Testament
description: Naskapi (also known as ᐃᔪᐤ ᐃᔨᒧᐅᓐ in the Naskapi language) is an Algonquian language spoken by the Naskapi in Quebec and Labrador, Canada. It is written in Eastern Cree syllabics. The Naskapi (Nascapi, Naskapee, Nascapee) are an Indigenous people of the Subarctic native to the historical country St'aschinuw, which is located in northern Quebec and Labrador, neighboring Nunavik. They are closely related to Innu Nation, who call their homeland Nitassinan.

language.name: Naskapi
language.area: Quebec and Labrador. 2 communities. Kawawachikamach about 10 km northeast of Schefferville in northeastern Quebec at watershed. On December 15, 2002 most of the Mushuau Innu moved from Utshimassits (Davis Inlet) to Natuashish on the mainland, an isolated community in Labrador.
